page.title: 01Landscape
page.content: This area includes the Eastern half of Ingoldmells village and a coastal strip of land which is low lying,flat and criss crossed with drainage dykes, except for the elevated coast road of Roman Bank.Protection from the sea is by sand dunes and the sea wall.Until the end of the 1939-1945 War,it was mainly mixed meadow and arable land except for Butlin's Holiday Camp built in 1936.Since then,along the coast North of Butlin's and Sea Lane,caravan sites have been developed.South of Butlin's is Winthorpe,a district of Skegness where there is the Derbyshire Miners' Holiday Home.Nearby is Carey House,a convalescent home for ex-hospital patients.In recent years an estate of bungalows has been erected in Eastern Ingoldmells.In summer the area is crowded and in winter it is deserted.
